author: jochembrouwer
content:
I have some general ideas/comments regarding this RPC topic:

I think the RPC is generally less conceived as critical, since it is not part of the (critical) protocol spec (like EVM changes). I would also not perceive this as critical firsthand, but when thinking about it I realized it is more critical than I would initially think. 

I think the post by Felix here https://notes.ethereum.org/@fjl/rpc-standards-2025-01 describes the situation very good and shows the relevance and the value of standardizing RPC.

I think that the RPC is thus conceived as less critical than it is and should definitely get more love. Maybe a good start would be to start raising awareness that a standard and the compliance with this would be more than just a nice-to-have. This would prevent disasters in the future where two clients have slightly different implementations and it would also help if we would setup more trustless methods. It also helps a lot if we start now (and we should likely have started much earlier ðŸ™‚ ) on this by the points raised by Felix about L2 clients forking our software and thus duplicating the ideas we now have / we will get in the future.
